User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

Sent an email to our intranet newsboard.
Noticed some mistakes and wanted to 'cancel message', what still works on TB3 and older.
(German: "Beitrag zurückziehen")


Actual results:

Cancel message ('Beitrag zurückziehen') is missing in context menu.
There is only a deactivated "löschen" (=delete).


Expected results:

There should be an Option like in TB3 and older for 'cancel message'.

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #4)
> You can get to Cancel Message by Message > Cancel Message in a newsgroup.
> 
Right, that's what I said.

> *Mutters something about there being too many menus*
It's not muttering, just everybody in my company, who are using Netscape and later Thunderbird since 15 years are a bit annoyed about this change, not longer being able to cancel a message with a simple right mouse click.

If this is against a new design police an "about config" toggle entry to enabel this menu again would be helpful for those, which learned a different "right mouse click habit" from Netscape and older Thunderbirds.

By the way, what was the reason to remove this possibility of the context menu?

Please, can someone edit this issue to Thunderbird 31 and correct the title?
